text: 500ml bottle. Clear copper colour with a thin white head. Aroma: malt, fruit, citrus. Taste: fruity, citrus, zest, biscuity malts, moderate bitter finish, good hop notes for a Bitter. Light-medium body, soft carbonation. Nice.
Cask at the Star and Garter, Bromley. Amber pour with a white head. Bake apple, citrus and light spice aroma. Stewed apple, light bitter citrus, malt and vanilla flavour. Nice, easy going brew.

Pours hazy amber to golden colour with almoat no top. Aroma is absent? Slightly skunky and fishy? Expected an awfull beer, but then the taste is pronounced carbonated, a little acrid and bitter. Hoppy finish, nothing special.
Cask at Heriot Watt. Clear amber. Nose is red fruits, sweetish. Tastes smooth, gently bitter, caramel, fruits. Decent.
Cask at Craft Clerkenwell. Clear amber with an off white head. Aroma of fruity hops, citrus and peach. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle from Beer Hawk. Odd. I like it but I was expecting a bitter, but this is like a bitter married with a stunningly hoppy IPA. The traditional bitter lover inside me is reeling, the beer geek is loving. If i wanted a bitter, id go for something else, and an IPA, id go for something else too but a nice experiment!! Huge grass hit upon first sip, very hoppy with huge hop aroma and aftertaste. Interesting.

Tasted this in the Salt Cot, Saltcoats (JDW) on the 8th January 2017. Cask, handpump dispense. Crystal clear pale amber in colour with a thin white head. Strong green hop notes present in the aroma. Thin resiny mouthfeel and good lacing. Pale malt delivers a full bodied digestive biscuit base with strong juicy pink grapefruit flavours unleashed in the mouth. Fresh dusty hop resins give a good counterpoint to the malt element and add complexity to the balanced bitter aftertaste. Finish is hoppy with tart citrus pink grapefruit still evident in the mouth. This is a decent session Bitter and I can see why people highly rate it

Cask Half Pint at London Drinker Beer Festival, London, March 2014 - Copper in colour. Hoppy; grassy and piney hops, nice hop bite. Fruity; tangy grapefruit-citrus and some tropical fruits. Malty; biscuity malts, some caramel. Nice balance. Very tasty for ABV. Very refreshing. Very drinkable. Enjoyed this a lot. Terrific; a Lovely Bitter. (2014-03-12)

0,5l from bottle at a party (about two weeks ago). BB 09/2017. Amber clear color, rather big off white head. smells lightly citric, light exotic fruits, bit grassy. decent smell. light Body, light carbonation, soft carbonation. tastes grassy, tobacco, light berry notes. finishes light to medium bitter with grassy and berry notes. rather average but drinkable.
Bottle at home, 14th December 16. Pours light copper. Aroma is light cararmel, hops. Taste is full, light hops, slight bitter, some caramel, floral. Very tasty modern refined bitter.
Cask. Liked this. Mid-amber with plenty of citrus in the profile but a good malty backbone prevents it from dominating and becoming too astringent. Very more-ish and sessionable.
Cask at the Prince of Wales in Farnborough beer festival. Great citrus aroma, nice balance of caramel malt and some dry hop with good citrus in the taste. Good bitter.
Keg at Inn Deep. Pours deep orange with a minute head which lingers. Aroma is weak grassy. Taste is citrus sweet, grassy bitter, muted caramel.
Gbbf. Fast klare orange goldene Farbe. Geruch zitronig hopfig, citrus. Geschmack zitronig hopfig, trocken leicht harzig, gut!

Cask ale taste. Only 4.3%. Citrus taste. Long aftertaste. Not bad. Lovely Amber colour 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours a clear brown-amber with a minimal off-white head. Aromas of floral and grassy hops, malt and summer fruit. Taste is similar, sweet and fruity up front, with dry floral hoppy notes, only a touch of bitterness, despite the hop flavours.
Wow great bitter great aroma and mix of hops almost like a session ipa in character tasty stuff indeed

Pint at the Alma, Cambridge. Light golden brown, almost but not quite clear. Gentle but pronounced floral aroma with some nectarine. Sweet taste with a hoppy balancing bitter edge. Peach and apricot flavours in the aftertaste. Thin body. But thus is unbelievably good for the ABV.

Draught. Amber pint with light head and light carbonation. Full fruity aroma with apples and lemon. Real fruity hit in the taste, quickly following into a long decent bitter finish. Hints of light biscuit, ginger. Clean and crisp. Cracking beer.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Clear dark honey amber with a small off-white head that quickly dissipates. Malty and fruity, fresh citrus aroma. Sweet caramel malt and fruit, fresh lasting hop bitterness . Very nice beer.

Cask at VIC Station Spoons. It pours clear golden - amber with a decent white head. The aroma is fresh, juicy, lemon parfait, biscuit, cereal, light caramel, grapefruit and polished wood. The taste is crisp, smooth, bitter, fresh, biscuit, lemon parfait, grapefruit, spice, cereal, caramel, wood and toasted nuts with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Balanced and delicious. Tasty golden bitter.

Cask at The Metropolitan (Spoons), Baker Street, London. A golden/amber coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Malty, fruity, caramel aroma. Tastes the same, malty, fruity, caramel, slightly sweet. Not bad but I dont think my pint was in particularly good condition, it was served way too warm and was slightly sour, a fresh pint would have scored better.
Cask at the Plough & Harrow. Golden with a lacing white head, fruity hoppy nose, dry, crisp and citrus-bitter over juicy malt, gorgeous stuff.
Cask at the standing order. Pours clear golden, nose is sweet toffee, light fruit, taste is similar, dry, light bitterness.

Cask at The Bishops Mill (JDW), Durham, £2.15/pint. 

Good-looking coppery amber beer with a smooth, white head. The aroma is appealing and full of hedgerow berries, citrus and jam. The taste is very fruity, with bittersweet citrus hop and sharp marmalade flavours. Theres also some doughy malt present. Salopian have a reputation for doing pale, hoppy ales like this very well and deservedly so - this is crisp, refreshing and enjoyable.
Cask at the JDW Figure of Eight; clear copper pour with a White head, aroma has some vibrant spice and citrus, taste has rich malts, citrus, some pine, bitter grapefruit.
Cask up the white lady. Pours clear golden amber with a thin white head. Aromas of citrus, light tropical fruit, light caramel. Taste is piney, more tropical fruit. Light bitter finish.

Bottle. Clear amber body with a thin white head. Low carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of Earl Grey tea, apricot and orange. Flavour of marmalade, grassy hops, juicy citrus and earth. Thin body with an oily mouthfeel. Light fizz. Delicate and supremely well balanced. Id love to try this hoppy Bitter on cask.

500ml bottle from Moonshine & Fuggles beer shop, Ironbridge. Clear golden amber colour, white foam head leaving lots of lacing and aroma of malt, grain, mellow fruit, citrus hop. Taste is malty, with tangy, fruity, note of yeast extract and almost metallic hoppy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry tangy lingering bitter finish. Nicely drinkable.

Golden ale. Piney, citrus aroma. More citrus, earth & spice in the mouth. A lovely pale cask beer.

Rated by BrewTom
Lovely bitter, aroma tastes of lemon zest to me, very enjoyable...................

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2015, Olympia, London - amber pour with white head. Toasty malty aroma and taste, nutty, some caramel , slight grassy, citric orange and some pine notes, twiggy and herbal hoppy, nutty, bitter finish.
Tried at the Peterborough beer festival 2015. Amber colour with a white head. Fruit and citrus hop aroma, crisp bitter finish.

Pours dark golden, clear and with a small white head. Lovely aromas of malt and a hint of fruit. Malty flavours with a good hoppy bitterness and some fruitiness. Easy drinking and refreshing. Solid bitter.

Cask at the GBBF 2015. Highg fluffy long lasting white head. Clear dark golden body. A bit sharp hops bitternes dominating the aroma. Flavor is also quite hops dominated with and unpleasant sour vedgetable, herbal note. Low carbarbonation. Long bitter finish.

Cask at GBBF 2015. Deep golden amber. Nice bubbly head. Great hoppy nose, grapefruit, nuts, earthy spices, malts. Tasty citrus and stone fruit, seet but fruity and tart hops, bit of pine. Very nice. Good bitterness.
Big-bubbled small white head. Clear amber. Pleasant malty and fruity hoppy aroma. Medium bodied, watery. Malty, bitter, dry.

Cask. Golden ale with a slight haze. White thick head. Smells of tangerines and fresh orange. Hint of fresh sweet grapefruit. Taste is fruity. Tangerine, gooseberry, honey and kumquat. Really nice. Like a sweet jam, with a bitter kiss.

500ml. No yeast at base, assuming not bottle-conditioned. Pours clear amber, thin white head. aroma: fruity hop. Taste: well balanced, fruity lingering hop. Mouthfeel: quite syrupy, lingering hop. Overall: First class beer. Well brewed, fruity and caramel taste..

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2017 Lovely fruity tarty flavour. Nice hoppy aroma.Strange mixture of hops and malt.Caramel and biscuit hints. Chestnut colour. Deceptive bite on the palate. Really refreshing and will drink again.

Wspaniale piwo pachnace perfumami kobiecymi, kilka chmieli, prestizowy zatecki, moj ulubiony Nelson Sauvin i Galaxy. Piekna piana o slimakowym wykonczeniu, spora i bardzo trawala, mocno zbita. Wyglad to jasny zolty kolor z lekka mgielka metnosci. Pachnace i smaczne piwo, z goryczka poterzna i wyraznym zaznaczeniu wszelkich profili chmielnych na jezyku,. polecam

Dark amber, white head, nose is lemon grapefruit citrous, grainy malt, touch toasted malt. Taste is a lightly toasty malty bitter with a kick of citrusy hops. Touch of pine in too. Grapefruit and lime rind on finish.
Cask. Pour is amber with a thin head, aroma is light fruity. Taste is bitter, earthy, minimally floral. Very nice

Bottle. Pours a clear dark blonde beer with a minimal amount of off white head on top, consisting out of big bubbles. Aroma is moderately malty, decent amount of some grassy, leafy hops and a crispy, citrussy note. Flavor is medium bitter, quite hoppy and fresh. Thin body, light moutfheel and very faint and short bitter aftertaste. A very easy going session beer.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2017 Cask at The White Star, Stoke (Titanic) a clear pale amber colour with medium off white head. Aroma of tangy lemon, orange, peach, maybe apricot, some caramel, a hint of herbs and slight spicy hops. Taste again of tangy lemon, orange, apricot, some peach, slight caramel, a hint of herbs and subtle spicy hops. Light bodied and a slight oily texture. A dryish, tangy, spicy hop  bitterness in the finish. Hoppy which I wasnt expecting, with a citrus tang and a hint of sweet malts. Good.
Cask by hand-pump at The Raven, Glasgow - clear golden amber, good creamy off-white head, grassy, spiced aroma, excellent lacing, grassy, spicy, easy to drink

Cask. Light hazy chestnut brown with a small off white head. Generously hopped; flowers, citrus. Some wooden notes, light toffee, grain, brown sugar. Hops dominate all the way through to the finish, with quite a bitter punch mid taste. Mild sweetness, long medium bitter finish. Sure is a hoppy bitter. Ok.

Cask @Ship & Castle, Aberystwyth. 13-08-2014.
Pours copper with nice off white head. Mango, fruity aromas. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is quite fruity, sweet, mango, Very enjoyable.

Cask @ GBBF 2014. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty caramel hoppy aroma. Fruity malty caramel hoppy flavor with hints of citrus. Has a fruity malty caramel hoppy finish.

Cask at Akkurat, Stockholm.  Hazy pale amber. Hay and fruit, notes of sulphur. Dry with light body and crisp, firm mouthfeel. Cookies, hay and minerals. Long bitter finish. Lovely and hugely drinkable.

Cask gravity at the Watford beer festival 2014. Orange light amber coloured pour with a lasting loose qjute head. Aroma is big spicy hop, pollen and some resin. Flavour is nutty malt with mice pollen, spicy hop with a little resin. Palate is semi sweet, bit watery. Pretty tasty.

Must admit I am a fan of big hoppy brews, and this is not a big hoppy brew, but nevertheless I love it. This beer is packed with loads of fruit, not to citrusy, but plenty of gooseberries and mango. A fine brew, refreshing and particularly moreish.

Cask at Akkurat.
Pours clear amber.
Nice malty and quite bitter hoppyness.
Cask @ Akkurat. A perfect autumn bitter with notes of apricots, marzipan, reisin, citrus and a well made cup of earl grey tea.
Pours a clear golden,thick white head. Aroma is sweet citrus,quite strong and pleasant on the pour. Taste is malt,citrus,slightly acidic,strong herbal bitterness.

Bottle from AlesByMail.co.uk.
Clear, amber body, with a medium, frothy, light beige head, that dissipates quickly.
Aroma is floral, fruity and sweet, with citrus, tangerine, some berries, caramel, herbs, grass.
Taste with about the same aromas, but with a dominant, herbal bitterness 
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation and it finishes bitter, dry, with herbs, grass and some fruity, citric notes.

Good. Nice citric and bitter, herbal hops, balanced by caramel notes. Overall nothing special and not a beer I would often drink, but surely a pretty beyond average Bitter.
ambrato scarico note agrumste leggero malto arancia discreta secchezza buona amaro finale agrumato

Aroma: light flowery hops, some grapefruit. Appearance: slightly cloudy light amber., small frothy white head. Taste: light sweet and bitter. Palate: light body, flat carbonation, average-long bitter finish. Overall: nice aroma and palate, yet could be more pronounced. Pint at GBBF 2014, Kensington.

Cask at GBBF. Clear dark orange with a bubbly white head. Aroma is strong orange and lemon. Body is medium, smooth. Taste is grapefruit, watery fruitsultra-drinkable. Woah this is a good cask ale. I wouldnt call it a bitter but, whatever it is, its good.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear golden with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, light caramel and moderate hoppy- citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 110614

Bottle, 4.3%. Clear deep golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, little caramel and a little earthy. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, caramel, little sweet, little earthy, little grass,
Bottle @ Christers. Pours light golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, grassy hops, light fruit. Flavor is malt, grassy, light bitter, light fruity hops. Medium body, average carbonation. 110614
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are bitter grassy hops, straw, malt and fruits. Nice bitter finish.

an incredibly balanced ale with a medium body and a cloudy Amber/Brown colour, a very nice aroma and a complex and satisfying taste. There are hints of fruits, flowers, caramel, some grassy hops and sweet malts. Its incredible how much is going on in this beer and how well everything is balanced.

Clear amber, slight sparkling, big off-white frothy head that leaves bit lacing. Mild aroma (having flu) is crisp with spruce and grass, malt also, bit soapy. Light to medium body, light palate, slight bitterness that stays to drying finish, sweet fruity notes also, floral notes. Easy to drink, tasty.

500 ml bottle. Clear dar golden colour, dense white head. Sweet aroma of fruits, berries and toffee, some woody notes. The flavour is sweetish malty, with citrus, berries and a nicely dry, a little woody, bitter hoppy finish. Very tasty.

Bottle shared with Button, under a tree, at Ripon races, 18th May. Clear gold. Bubbly, white head. Lots of grapefruit. Some citrus. Light spice. Taste and palate are dry and fresh. Plenty of bitter hops on the finish.

It pours a clear, dark gold color with an off white head. The aroma has some toasty and sweet toffee malts up front followed by some fruit and spice. The flavor is more toast and toffee with some spicy hop bitterness and mild fruity esters. Pretty watery on the palate with good carbonation and a decently dry, snappy finish. A very drinkable bitter.

Bottled. Pours clear golden in color with a white head. Citrus, forrest pine, tea leafs and garden fruity bushes in aroma. Bitter grapefruit and notes berry sweetness in taste. Bitter at first, but takes a turn into a more sweeter way towards the finish.

0.5 l bottle, thanks hanniku! Copper color. Very fruity aroma with tangerine, orange and lemon. Dry, bitter, fruity, slightly nutty and slightly biscuity flavor with restrained lemon, tangerine and pepper. Fairly smooth palate with bitter minerally finish. Light bodied. Good easy drinking yet fairly hop-forward ale.

Bottle. Light amber, average to large and mostly lasting head. Moderate, lightly sweetish and malty aroma, faint caramel, tropical fruitiness, grapefruit and piney hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, faint caramel and light tropical fruitiness, grapefruit and piney hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, light fruitiness, bit sharp piney and some grapefruit hoppyness. Nice well hopped bitter - not too sweet.

Cask at the Walsall CAMRA Beer Festival 2014. Poured a crystal clear medium amber with a bubbly white head. The aroma is citrus hop, light malt. The flavour is medium to light bitter with a watery hop bitter light fruit palate. Medium to light bodied with soft carbonation. A great session beer.

50cl [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Clear amber, thin white head. Woody, citrusy fruity and herbal aroma. Solid. Flavor has citrus, grapefruit, biscuity notes. Hoppy finish, quite dry and with grapefruit lingering. A hoppy bitter. But this is a great beer, the "bitter" elements are clearly there, with the  us hops complementing. I could drink this every day.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Brown color with little head.
Aroma has tropical fruit, citrus. Great for beer of this strengh.
So is flavor. Malty and fruity, very bitter. Thin, obviously.
Bottle @ home. Clear golden color, medium sized white head. Aroma and taste are malts, nicely hoppy and nicely bitter. A bit thin texture, decent body, suitable carbonation. Nice beer!
Pours a pale colour, light bodied and hoppy. This was a gem of a beer, much better than I was expecting

A light brown beer with a weak and white head. The nose is quite fresh, nice. Citrusfruits, some toffee and fresh wood. Taste of nuts, some toffee, surprisingly strong hoppyness, some citrusfruits, wood and harsh herbs. The end is more traditional with a dry wood. Light+ bodied, smooth and mild carbonation. Positive beer. Quite fresh, also citrusfruits and courage hoppyness.

500ml bottle. Clear, orangey, deep golden colour with average, frothy, fluffy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Hoppy aroma delivers a plethora of flavours: piney, herbal, citrusy, fruity; hints of grapefruit and orange. Taste is dry hoppy, mineral, slightly grainy and strawy, minimally piney.
Cask at Black Door, Helsinki. Colour is slightly cloudy orange with small foamy white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, grape, hops and malts. Very fruity bitter.
Cask in the Admiral Benbow, Shrewsbury. Amber with a white head. Nice pineapple aroma and flavours and a good bitter finish. Something a touch woody about it, but in a good way. Nice.
500ml. ar: grapefruit hop. ap: gold, clear, minimal head. ta: grapefruit, quite dry, appropriate bitterness. pa: medium bodied, dry finish. ov: a reasonable beer. Strong grapefruit flavour.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ beer festival
Hazy pale gold, fresh hop aroma, citrus and passion fruit. Dry tropical bitterness well balanced by malt, gentle carbonation.

Cask at The Old Hand & Diamond, Coedway. How has it taken me this long to try this beer?? Exceedingly well-balanced bitter with a good malt base & pillow soft earthiness with a fruity hop character. Same again barman.

JDW, Rochester. Lovely fresh citric burst. Cool and refreshing. Good marriage of clean biscuit malt and bittering hops. A little rough and dusty in the finish, but likeably so. Nothing special, but nicely done.

Bouteille de 500 ml partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal. Arôme: Légère odeur de céréale et dagrume. Apparence: La couleur est dorée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréale avec une pointe dhoublon herbacé et de pamplemousse. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de céréale en arrière goût. (Rating #5077)

Bottle. Missus made me buy it- thought Id rated this years ago. Deep bronze with a creamy, heavy-lacing lid. Aroma of good freshly-pinched hop cone, digestive biscuits, root veg, dried curry leaf, peachy Southern Comfort. Decent floral and peachy effort with sneaking bitterness and malt-heavy US IPA leanings.

Cask at wetherspoons Victoria. Pours an amber colour with a thin white head. Fruity bready aroma. Light to medium body. A little tropical fruit alongside malt loaf followed by a dry, bitter grapefruity finish. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cask at The Moon Under Water (JDW), Watford on 24 July 2013. Poured a clear amber with a lingering white head. Citrus hop aromas. Flavours of grass and grapefruit followed by a little bitter resin. Best beer Ive had in JDW for a while...
Dark amber pour. Clean hops and fizzy on the tongue. Reminiscent Danyul? Who was the OG? Adam? Moses? Chuck Norris?

Bottle from @baron_orm - thanks! [180713]
Amber, clear, frothy white head that dissipates quickly
Aroma of lemon citrus, caramel malts, some biscuit, good aroma
Taste of citrus, pithy grapefruit, some lemon, lot of citrus hop for an amber bitter, brown caramel malts, biscuit, slight earthy hops, some toasted malts, quite complex, very good flavour 
Palate - Soft carb, medium body, tangy fairly sweet citrus with toasted bitter biscuit malts. Finish as mina flavour, citrus biscuit, good linger, extra wave of bitterness in the tail, clean finish
Overall - One of the best English bitter beers, very well put together, just very good

My Bottom Line:
Spicy, citrusy and delightfully crisp, this Bitter closes on a green hop bitterness which latches on to the tastebuds just long enough for you to wonder how soon your next sip can be.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the clear amber.
-The carbonation is fluffy.
-Malts also develop toasty angles.
-The citrusy, spicy hop character is tight and nuanced.

Bottle.

Chewy, spicy nose with peppered pineapple and big gobs of pine sap. Pours medium copper with a fluffy head. Taste is complex but balanced with orange peel, cloves, papaya, pine needles and the forest floor theyre sat on. Finish is dry, tart and moreish. An excellent session beer.

Bottle from Salopian - thanks! Thin body, with tongue tickling carbonation. Flavour is somewhat reminiscent of a digestive biscuit soaked in lemon barley drink. Somewhat. Light and crisp Bitter, which has a traditional Black Country motif, but with a clean hop feel - like a fluffy cloud. Abv makes this light, but its also refreshing.
On keg at Syston Social Beer Festival 2013.  Amber ale with an interesting sweet malt aroma.  Taste is pretty one dimensional bitter fare.  Decent.
Has a full tropical fruit aroma in a cloudy golden coloured ale with a thick creamy head.  Its crisp but only a little fruit is apparent in the flavour.

Cask at the Merchants Inn, Rugby, 06/03/13.
Lightly hazed golden amber with a white head. Good lacing ensues.
Nose is grapefruit, tropical notes, orange, hops, pineapple.
Taste comprises light pine, hops, juicy tropical fruits, orange, grapefruit.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry in the finish.
Decent fayre from Salopian - as usual!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, wolverhampton. Amber beer, thick creamy head with good pacing. Excellent looking beer. Aroma is grapefruit hops. Taste is hops a mix of them quite sweet as well. Smooth and medium bodied on the palate. This is an excellent bitter. Impressive.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: 500 mL bottle from Beers of Europe.  Clear amber, good head.  Grapefruity hop aroma.  Bitter and fruity.  A bit one dimensional however, though a good bitter.  Bitter and dry.

On cask at The Bird In Hand, Cheadle. Typical golden ale colour, very clear and clean looking with a white head. In the aroma, hops were present, some sweetness and citrus notes. Taste was first of citrus fruits, particularly grapefruit, a good malt background, quite sweet and certainly some good hop bitterness. The hops leave a nice, bitter aftertaste, the taste of grapefruit lingers aswell, medium bodied. A very good session ale, incredibly drinkable, plenty of flavour and not too strong.

Is Darwin the original evolutionary theorist in the same vein as Ice-T being the original gangster (or should that be Gangsta?). If so he is a charlatan *glances in mirror* as Ice-T aint no original gangster, though I did love that album - he may lack MC skills and kick-ass beats but hes a brilliant storyteller. Much like this beer without the brilliant storytelling.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2012 Re-rate this time from 50cl bottle. More fruit on the nose this time, maybe burnt oranges. The finish has a pistachio nut and bran flakes.  Slightly better this time! 

Previous rating 11/08/12 6+4+6+3+12=3.1
On tap @ the Boathouse, Shrewsbury. Pours cloudy, amber orange with nice head. The nose is of chocolate biscuits with grapes. The taste is of biscuits and apples. The palate is medium bodied with a creamy texture and a tangy finish. Overall a solid bitter.
UPDATED: MAY 27, 2012 Cask @ The Rake. Clear amber brown colour, good head. Fruity hoppy aroma & flavour. Bitter aftertaste. Amazingly hoppy for a bitter. This is really good.

Dark amber, white head, nose is lemon grapefruit citrous, grainy malt, touch toasted malt. Taste is a lightly toasty malty bitter with a kick of citrousy hops. Touch of pine in too. Grapefruit and lime rind on finish.
Pours clear dark brown with a small head. Aroma hops, grass. Very bitter and somewhat dry. Not Bad.

(Cask at Kuikka, 20120416) The beer poured golden and a bit hazy. Its head was medium sized, white and long lasting. Aroma had fruitiness, citricness, grapefruit and grain. Palate was medium bodied with low carbonation. Flavours were hops, fruitiness, grass, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy, grainy and bitter. Very tasty beer with really god hoppiness.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2012 Cask (Kuikka, Helsinki)
Beautiful fruity hoppy aroma, grapefruitya and citrussy, and just a bit of sweet caramelly malts too. Nice orange, small loose head. Lovely full body, great dry bitterness and good breadiness too. Spot on english bitter. As full as an Oakham or a Thornbridge, but with a very very easy unchallanging face, no aggression to it at all. I would session this. Totally delicious.

Oct 2010 I wrote this:500ml Brown bottle reviewed 4 days after its best before date on a wet and windy cold evening 12 miles from where it was brewed. 

Poured into an Abbot Ale tankard, it showed a light amber/copper body with a good foaming head which sadly soon turned into a thin covering. The head did leave some lacing as the beer fell. 

The aroma was of hops and yeast esters, hints of all spice. Unusual for an English Bitter, this asks to be served cool on the label. 

The taste is a bitter, spritzy hop flavour. 

The beer had a fresh, young feel to it, even though it was just out of date. 

Salopian beers are always a pleasure to drink and this is typical of their products, very drinkable.  The cask version is slightly better in my eyes, often available around here!

Cask Real Ale 0.25L at Kittys. Mild malty nose with some grapefruit. Pale head (2mm). Golden slightly hazy colour. Fresh fruity hopped taste with sour berries and lemon and some grapefruit too. At the end hoppy bite.

Cask @ Kittys, Helsinki

Pours clear copper orange with a smooth and foamy white head. Strong citrusy and fruity aroma with notes of malts. Taste is smooth with a lot of citrusy and fruity notes, some bitterness and hints of malts. Finish is bitter and nicely fruity. Well balanced, fruity and tasty bitter. Real ale at its finest.
On cask at The Heriot-Watt Beer Festival. Pours a dark golden colour with a fair head. Aroma of grassy hops, yeast and caramel. Similar flavours and quite dry with lingering lemon citrus hop notes.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2012 Cask at the Kittys, Helsinki, Finland.
Clear deep golden colour with small off-white head. Floral hops, mild bitterness and some malt in aroma. Sweetish caramel, bitterish fruity/floral hops and some sugary sweetness. Drinkable.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2014 
Cask @ OHaras Freehouse
Aroma is rather light with some fruits, caramel and bread. Flavour is really fruity and tasty with some bread, hay, nuts and hints of toffee. Tasty, one of the best real ales Ive had

Cask @ OHaras, Tampere.
Pours a copper colour with a small white head. Aroma of strong floral hops, biscuity malts and some citrus. Flavour of strong floral hops, biscuit, toasted malts, citrus, nuts and strong hay. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a bitter, fruity and dry finish. Nice and tasty bitter.
500ml bottle.  Pours dark gold with a medium, frothy head.  Aroma is lime jelly hops, little orange underneath.  Taste has dirty lime to start, with an earthy, medium bitter finish.

Cask
Rated on 20110725.
Clear copper colour with small head. Aroma of mild fruits, some malts and grass. Flavour of nuts, malts, fruits and hay.
3313

Bottle. Bronze and very clear.Low carbonation and left no lacing.Hoppy floral flavour with a medium body. Lingering hoppiness. Exoected a run of the mill bitter but this came  as an excellent surprise.
On cask at Coachmakers Arms, Hanley.  Fruity start, golden pour with decent white head.  An excellent golden ale with low carbonation
Cask at GBBF 2010. An amber beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of spices and flowers. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and straw as well as lighter notes of spices.

Cask at the Crosse Keys,  JDW. Clear, vibrant gold with a moderate, white head. Lovely nose, rife with citra hops, lemon, hay and crackery malts. Flavor follows perfectly, light to medium sweet, sun-kissed malts, lemon, hay, grass bitterness. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Crisp, refreshing finish, slightly sticky, plenty of citrusy hops and just the right amound of malty sweetness. Great beer.

Cask (gravity dispense) at Wandsworth Common Beer Festival @ Le Gothique on 25 March 2011. Sketchy notes as I thought Id rated this before. Amber colour. Not sure what the hops here are as it is supposedly made using "hops from around the world", but there theres a fair ration of em. Strong on grapefruit. Clean and sharp mouthfeel. Very quaffable.

Clear deep golden color, steady white creamy head. Very light and honeyish aroma. Light palate. Flavor is slightly honeyish with light lemony hoppyness. Leading to slightly sweetish and hoppy aftertaste. Boring. (6/2/5/2/9 2.4)

Pale amber color, small white head. Piney-apricot fruity aroma. Light palate. Piney hoppy flavor with dry woodyness and grapefruit. Lingering bitterness in the aftertaste. Simple but in better condition than one I sampled a year ago. (7/3/7/2/11 3.0)
17th May 2009 Spoons Fest.Clear light amber beer. Semi dry palate. Rich grapefruit hops with a good balance of sweet malt.
Cask. Amber gold with a medium white head. Citrus aroma and flavour, some hops with a dry bitter finish. Nice enough, just not the style to get my fires burning.

Cask.
Cloudy amber coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and grass with notes of puke.
Fruity flavour of hops, grass and pine needle.s
Dry hoppy finish.

Cask (gravity) - Norwich Beer Festival 2010. Poured a mildly unclear orange with a small & bubbly, regenerative white head, some lace. Bright & zesty US(-esque?) hops: tangerine, grapefruit, lemon sherbet. All that is replicated quite nicely on the tongue, though not quite as forthcoming - slightly dry, more lemon & grassy hop dominance. Bright, crisp mouthfeel & refreshing, light to medium carbonation. Finishes well on a light body. Quite a corker.
Cask. Notts Fest 2010. Thin white head, clear amber body. Bitter, sweet notes. Citrus, caramel, grapefruit, grass, peach, apricot. Sweet dry finish, silky syrupy texture. A darn good pint.

Cask-conditioned at the Three Tuns, Bristol 1/10/10. Deep gold with a slight white head. Hoppy aroma with both grapefruit and a grassy edge. Flavour was well balanced with some decent sweetish malts and plenty of citrus hop, before a dry finish. Very enjoyable.

(Cask at GBBF London Earls Court, 4 Aug 2010) Dark golden colour with brief, off-white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with notes of citrus, grass and apricots. Fruity, malty taste with citrus, apricots, sweet malt and citrussy  hops. Medium body, fairly sweet. Quite nice.
Cask at GBBF 2010, 4th Aug 2010. Amber. Floral, citrus nose. Citrus carries right through to the finish. Decent, in fact excellent light bitter.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is quite hoppy with some mild nutty and wooden notes. Flavour is fruits, wood, herbs, nuts and some mild notes of caramel as well.
From cask. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is fruity and mild citrusy. Sweet and citrusy hops flavoured. citrusy and bitter dry finish.
Nicked of Ethereal at GBBF 2010. Lovely citric hop nose, very perfumed. Golden colour, no head. Slightest carbonation. Good smooth mouthfeel. Good citric taste. Great simple and stunning!

Thick little hoppiness on the nose with plenty of peach and apricot style aromas.  It is smoky and hoppy in the mouth with a good sweetness.  It doesnt have a perfect finish but is still remarkaboy complex

Cask, Fly in the Loaf, Liverpool. Amber with a good sized white head. Aroma gently fruity with some grassy hop. Plenty of juicy citrus and more hop in the flavour which was clean and refreshing with some unobtrusive malt leading to a lingering bitter finish. Straightforward and tasty drop. Cheers Charlie!

A Mes rate. Cask at the Railway View, Macclesfield.Clean gold with a good white head with plenty of condition. Decent lemon sherbet hop snout. Good citric bitterness in the mouth with a nice dry feel. Slight mineral notes with a faint floral hint too. Not brimming with character but pleasant and drinkable.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2010 1. Cask Handpump at the Crown Inn, Stockport 25/07/2009
Pale hoppy aroma. Clear golden coloured hoppy and fruity grapefruit flavour with a dry and slightly malty finish.
2. Cask Handpump at the GBBF, Earls Court 05/08/2010
Fruity hop aroma. Golden coloured pale and hoppy with a grapefruit flavour. A hint of dryness in a bitter malt finish.

50cl bottle from Bernies, Shirley. Amber with a thin cream head; rich malty aroma with a touch of orange; smooth and creamy with sharp citrus and jammy malts; well-balanced sharp biscuity bitterness to finish. Excellent.

Handpulled cask at Crosse Keys, Monument (JDW). Amber with a white head. What a nice surprise. A cracking best bitter full of citrus resinous hops that balance out against a buiscuty malt background. Excellent.
Cask in the alfread herring, palmers green. Alroudn rating: Pale malts, light wheaty esters, citrusy lemoon and grassy bitterness. Good bitter finish.

Cask Ludlow Spring Event
Vibrant juicy copper ale with a strong pronounced hop character. Grassy and citrus hops everywhere.

Cask (handpump) @ The Standing Order, 6266 George Street, Edinburgh EH2 2LR, Scotland.Clear medium amber color with a average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, moderate hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, orange shell, pepper notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20090409]

Cask conditioned	handpump	Duke Of Wellington	Shoreham	A dark gold coloured beer with an off white head. The aroma and taste both have lovely citrussy hops.  Nice orange fruit notes throughout and excellent drinkability.  Almost a bit of marmalade in there.

Cask at Spoons, Milton Keynes. Lemon, lime and a curious suggestion of cat in the aroma. Fruity taste has further feline qualities and a heavy, ashy bitterness like untipped cigarettes. I found this beer quite challenging and forceful.

Cask handpull at Society Rooms, JDW, Maidstone.  After drinking some disappointing festival beers, this was superb.  Gold, lasting beige head.  Lots of grapefruit hop on aroma.  Lots of hops everywhere.  That is excellent uber hoppy beer for the UK.  Resiny hops, lovely.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2009 Cask at JDW edinburgh... amber ... creamy head ... light fruity hiop nose ... big hop grapefruit and little pine ... bitter linger... 3.6 Cask at JDW winchester ... amber ... white lacing ... big grapefruithopnose ... bitter but very fruity ... loads of grapefruit... juicy with drying linger... 3.6

Bottle.  Golden brown with a small head.  Aromas are sweet grapefruit and hay with citrus and floral notes.  Very hoppy.  Flavours are sweet grapefruit and apricot with spicy, floral hops.  Dry with bitter grapefruit on the finish.  A good, refreshing bitter.
UPDATED: FEB 25, 2009 Good golden pint, nice egg-white frothy head, smell is hoppy and light, taste is pleasant fruity, bitter hops and a little malt.  Nice crisp bitter finish.  Good pint.

Cask conditioned at The Woolpack, Banbury Beer Fest ’08. Copper coloured with white head. This is indeed a lovely hoppy bitter, good malty, deeper body carrying loads of fruity flavours, there are lychees and grapefruit for me. This is a happy and engaging beer and I liked it.

Cask at the Woolpack Beer Festival 08, Banbury, Oxon, in the company of Glen, Trev and a good sprinkling of local CAMRA members   Poured copper as the description suggested. This beer had the most lovely floral and perfumed nose, wonderfully hoppy (US hops maybe?) and some nice honey touches. Taste really was a follow on, i.e. all that was on the aroma showed itself quite beautifully in the mouth, lovely sweet honey, punchy but softened hops held in check by the malty body to this beer.  I really liked this even if it was just a tad sweet at times. If I have a criticism it could have done with the hops and bitteness presenting themselves a bit more and just pushing the honey sweetness back a little but thats just my personal preference, it was a well made and very good beer. Riight up there with the Leeds ’Gathering Storm’ for me as the two beers of the night, but just pipped at the post by the Leeds beer.
